project.teaser: The aim of the project is to foster the dialogue and development towards more inclusive, dynamic, (gender) diverse and interconnected innovation ecosystems in Europe to reach the European common data space in health. The joint action plan to be developed in the context of the...
project.objective:
The aim of the project is to foster the dialogue and development towards more inclusive, dynamic, (gender) diverse and interconnected innovation ecosystems in Europe to reach the European common data space in health. The joint action plan to be developed in the context of the project is oriented at overcoming the current deployment gap of digital health in Europe and to unlock the power of health data for innovative medicine and healthcare of the future, enabling new scientific discoveries, innovative commercial health products and services, all in all resulting in more efficient prevention and treatment of illnesses and ensuring a better quality of life in Europe and globally.
The consortium includes four clusters/networks, all representing broad innovation ecosystems, that have for many years been working to advance the secondary use of health data and creation of the common European Health Data Space. This includes Biocat, BioRegion of Catalonia (Biocat; coordinating country: Spain), Council of European BioRegions (CEBR; based in Belgium), Health Cluster Portugal (HCP, Portugal) and ScanBalt network (SB; Estonia). The consortium takes leadership in coordinating the project activities but a wide range of clusters, bioregions and wider ecosystem stakeholders will be engaged in the project based on the joint effort of the core partners.
project.title: Interconnecting innovation ecosystems for common European data space in Health
project.keywords: European Health Data Space, digitalisation, interconnecting ecosystems

article.title: The future of health and care data in Europe

result.title: Case study: Sweden
result.description: Case studies on seven key EU clustersnetworks will be carried out in order to 1 facilitate learning from various good practices of strong EU clustersnetworks in advancing digital health and related innovation in their regions countries as well as good practices related to quadruple helix collaboration 2 reach a better understanding of the ecosystems and innovation agendas of these clustersnetworks In case of Sweden we will additionally focus on the possibilities of advancing specific topics related to the EHDS in the context of the upcoming EU presidency in the clustersnetworks country of origin

result.title: Policy Input Report 1: Swedish Presidency of the EU
result.description: Developing the Policy Input Report for Sweden which sums up the collaboration process with the national authorities in the presidency country and the input provided to the presidency agenda central topics as well as the results in terms of how the presidency context helped to scaleup the dialogue by involving additional stakeholders and to reach a shared understanding about how to move on with developing several aspects of the EHDS covering also inputs in terms of the JAP

result.title: Project website
result.description: The project website wil be set upThe project website event specific subpages and social media platforms LinkedIn Youtube Telegram will be the main channels for communication alongside national and international professional networks media etc

result.title: Case study: Bulgaria
result.description: Case studies on seven key EU clustersnetworks will be carried out in order to 1 facilitate learning from various good practices of strong EU clustersnetworks in advancing digital health and related innovation in their regions countries as well as good practices related to quadruple helix collaboration 2 reach a better understanding of the ecosystems and innovation agendas of these clustersnetworks In case of Bulgaria we will additionally focus on the possibilities of advancing specific topics related to the EHDS in the context of the upcoming EU presidency in the clustersnetworks country of origin

result.title: Policy Input Report 1: Spanish Presidency of the EU
result.description: Developing the Policy Input Report for Spanish EU Presidency, which sums up the collaboration process with the national authorities in the presidency country and the input provided to the presidency agenda (central topics) as well as the results in terms of how the presidency context helped to scale-up the dialogue by involving additional stakeholders and to reach a shared understanding about how to move on with developing several aspects of the EHDS, covering also inputs in terms of the JAP.

result.title: Case study: Belgium
result.description: Case studies on seven key EU clustersnetworks will be carried out in order to 1 facilitate learning from various good practices of strong EU clustersnetworks in advancing digital health and related innovation in their regions countries as well as good practices related to quadruple helix collaboration 2 reach a better understanding of the ecosystems and innovation agendas of these clustersnetworks In Belgium we will additionally focus on the possibilities of advancing specific topics related to the EHDS in the context of the upcoming EU presidency in the clustersnetworks country of origin

result.title: 2nd Dialogue Progress Report
result.description: The EDAH Coordination Working Group (CWG) will be setting up various specific dialogues (task 3.2) with different types of stakeholders who are important to be involved regarding the particular topic. Suitable methods for dialogue, co-creation and co-planning will also be decided by the CWG.A particular emphasis is placed on the inclusiveness of the dialogue and engaging all relevant stakeholder groups to have their perspectives represented when discussing the different topics and agreeing on how to take joint action related to these matters.The progress and results of the dialogue processes will be summarised in annual Dialogue Progress Reports, giving also an overview of the participants in all dialogue processes started/ongoing this year (incl. overview of type of stakeholder (e.g., patient organisations, industry, R&D organisations, etc.), region and country (incl. the Regional Innovation Scoreboard perspective), gender balance in dialogue and other important information.

result.title: Case study: Hungary
result.description: Case studies on seven key EU clusters/networks will be carried out in order to 1) facilitate learning from various good practices of strong EU clusters/networks in advancing digital health and related innovation in their regions/ countries as well as good practices related to quadruple helix collaboration; 2) reach a better understanding of the ecosystems and innovation agendas of these clusters/networks. In case of Hungary, we will additionally focus on the possibilities of advancing specific topics related to the EHDS in the context of the upcoming EU presidency in the clusters´/networks´ country of origin.

result.title: Final version of the Joint Action Plan
result.description: The final version of the JAP will be developed after integrating the feedback and inputs received from the validation process.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - EDAH (Interconnecting innovation ecosystems for common European data space in Health)
result.teaser: EDAH (Interconnecting innovation ecosystems for common European data space in Health) brings together 4 European clusters in Digital Health and Life Sciences that share the objective to foster the dialogue and development towards more inclusive, dynamic, (gender) diverse and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
